location.physicalLocation: British Library: India Office Records and Private Papers

titleInfo.title: Letter No. 56 of 1856 from Commander James Felix Jones, Acting Resident in the Persian Gulf, at Bushire to Henry Bartle Edward Frere, Commissioner in Scinde [Sind]

mods.abstract: The letter is a reply to the proposal to extend telegraphic communication from Kurrachee [KarƒÅchi] to Constantinople via the Persian Gulf. It explains that the Resident does not conceive the proposal to be practical, and cites the lack of control of the Turkish Government over some of its territory as the reason; he therefore thinks it would be pointless for him to advise on suitable routes.
